values:
Hello LJ!

It's been so long that I had to reset my password because I forgot what it was.

Work has been stressing me out lately.
I got a new camera.  Actually, the bf got me a new camera for my bday.  Hopefully this will motivate me to get back into photography... really miss it.

I'm dog-sitting this little guy for my parents this week. My dad went to a conference up in Seattle and my mom tagged along.  He's such a good dog... loves to cuddle and loves to play.  The only thing is that he has separation anxiety whenever I leave.  He's still a puppy though, I guess it just takes time for him to get used to being alone.

long (but fun) day with the fam.  had our annual easter picnic at the park today.  was running on 3 hours of sleep cause i ended up going out last night and the parents guilted me into going to the 7am mass.  by the way, last night was surprisingly fun! i had my mind set on just staying in and making it a netflix night but my roommate coaxed me into going out by getting me drunk. so i ended up tagging along with him and his friends to el camino for one of his buddy's bday... who, by the way, is a total cutie!

anyway, i ended up passing the eff out after getting home from the picnic.  out cold for 4 hours straight.  and now i'm up and can't go back to sleep!

Testing out the lj app on my iPad. This is pretty cool. :)

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPad.

Yes, I started last week.  I was on a good roll but then Friday came... and then the weekend came.  And then it was Monday lol.  Got back into today though with Plyometrics, which is getting easier.  It wasn't as grueling as it was last week.

I posted this chart next to my door in my room so it's in my face every single day.  I give myself one of these awesome stickers every time I complete a workout :).  My biggest challenge is finding time to fit in a workout in my day.  I'm not a morning person, so working out before work is out of the question.  However, it may have to come down to that cause sometimes I get home late from work and I'm too hungry to do anything.  On the plus side, my roommate started this week too.  I'm finding it easier to get through a workout when someone else is doing it too.  We went grocery shopping last night and we're gonna try to follow the p90x diet as well.

So, we'll see how it goes.  Part of the reason why I'm posting this is to make myself feel more accountable to follow through with the entire program.  Come July, I'll the that beach body I've always wanted.  And HELL NO, I'm not posting before pics lol.
Thinking about going back in June.  I need to get away.

I was on vacation all last week visiting my cousin in NYC.  I'll try to get more photos from my trip up here but they'll most likely end up on my tumblr... or facebook.... or none of the above lol.  It all depends on how busy (read: lazy) I am these next few days.

Wow, it's been a long time since I've been here. Not much going on. Work is keeping me busy. Been posting on my tumblr page more lately.... but mostly photos I've already posted here. I started training for a marathon back in January. We're up to 14 miles this weekend. I'm kinda scared though cause I totally blew off my mid-week training sessions this week. Anyway, I'm off to bed. Gnight. :)
My impression of a lampshade
I needed this badly since I've only watched the first two seasons. I'm still lost but I'm excited for the premiere. 02/02/10!!

Day 7: Benjamin Not a great shot, but it's all I had on the last day of my 7 day project. I think I'll try doing another one of these mini-projects. Not right now though, life is too hectic. Going through too many transitions right now.

Especially the cover of "Sweet Love" at the end.

<lj-embed id="129"/>

These pics are from Christmas Eve. This year's theme was "Italy," and I made a yummy mushroom risotto. We also played a bunch of games and had a gingerbread house making contest. You'll see in the pics. I was too lazy to bust out my dslr so these are all snapshots taken with my bro's new Canon s90.

Appetizers Pastas, turkey, and more.... Us with grandma. Grandma with all the grandchildren. Our first game. I was #18. My uncle, trying to be funny. hahahahha In this game you had to put a candy cane in between your legs and drop it into a glass bowl. Our team won, btw. The team in the video below didn't do so well, especially the guys. White elephant time! Matt, Teri, Emy Andrew, Tori, Jeffrey My cousin, Julia, explaining the rules. Time for the gingerbread houses. We broke into four teams and were each given equal amounts of supplies: graham crackers, frosting, marshmallow fluff, and candy. We had a total of an hour to build our houses. This team made an RV, but to me it looked like a jeepney. Sticking with the Italian theme, this team made the Leaning Tower of Pisa. Justin, the budding architect, constructed the Sears Tower. Oh, and our team? We decided to make a yacht but we were experiencing issues with our structural integrity. So we went in another direction and named our creation, The Titanic. Notice the rafts with jelly bean people on it, with the minorities (represented by the darker jelly beans) still on the sinking ship lol. Team RV Team Leaning Tower Team Sears Tower Team FAIL! haha The judges In the end, we all got medals. It was another fun Christmas with the family.

-Simplify my life
-Improve my Spanish
-Take more photos
-Save money

2009 was shitty.  I'm ready for the new year.
D. U. I. Stop - Funny home videos are a click away

Sunday night my cousin made us chicken katsudon for dinner. It was mighty delicious.

Flour, egg, and panko. Throw it in the pan and fry it. She and Matt have an awesome kitchen with a commercial grade stove. Charlie likes hanging out in the kitchen, hoping for something to fall from above. Preparing the sauce. A side of broccoli. Time to grub!
Day 6: Miles This is Dat's little nephew. He's a happy kid; always laughing or smiling. I caught him in a serious moment.

Day 5 Another one of Mr. Charlie, taken just before we took him out for a walk along the reservoir earlier this afternoon. This one's straight out of the camera. Gotta love window light on cloudy days.
In my cousin's kitchen.
Day 4: Charlie Charlie tilts his head whenever you ask him a question, e.g., "Do you wanna go outside?"

Day 3 It rained pretty much all day yesterday. I'm in LA right now, Silverlake to be exact, staying at my cousin's place. We went to J Lounge in downtown last night for a friend's birthday. Had fun drinking, dancing, and acting stupid with some old friends. Today we're preparing dinner for my auntie, who's in town. This weather is perfect for staying indoors and preparing a meal.
Day 2 Taken in my bf's backyard yesterday afternoon.

Fallen star I swear, this leaf landed perfectly between my shoes as I was sitting in the grass late yesterday afternoon. I took the time to enjoy today's sunny, albeit chilly, weather before I start my new job next Wednesday.

I made this one my desktop wallpaper on my mac. View it large on black.

Rockin' my wayfarers.

I wanted a clean shot of just his head while sitting up, but he kept putting his head down so I had to hold it in place lol.
Paris through the lens of my Holga on a cold afternoon.
===.=== "Loneliness adds beauty to life." - Henry Rollins

My parents went persimmon picking last weekend, as they do every year. They never fail to bring home bags and bags of these things as if it's the most magnificent fruit. I personally don't see the appeal to persimmons. It's like eating cardboard. View On Black
We carved pumpkins at my grandma's house last night. This was my pumpkin. I still have to figure out a Halloween costume. Something easy, but cool lol. Might go up to LA to celebrate.
T This is my cousin, Teri. Random childhood memory: when we were 5 we locked ourselves in the bathroom and cut each other's bangs off. (I might have mentioned that in a previous post.. I dunno.)

Bigger Old Town, San Diego, California If you're driving north from downtown on the 5, you'll pass an artists supply store with this awesome mural. I stopped by to snap this, and someone was watching me the whole time lol. The colors are much better in person, these polaroids don't really capture that very well.
Zephyr
Something I saw in the front yard yesterday. View On Black

We ate at Nobu last night for Charlotte's bday. The food was probably the best I've ever had (the sauces were amazing) BUT waaaaay overpriced for the portion sizes they give. We took a cig break after downing come cocktails before our meal cause the wait was rather long. l Iooked over at Charlotte standing under this light and told her to strike a pose. The quality on this is really bad cause of the ISO setting... and I'm really bad at keeping a steady hand when I'm buzzed. After dinner we were gonna go hit up some other bars in downtown but Charlotte realized she forgot her ID at home. FAIL. Instead, we drank at Russel's and reminisced about high school.
Consume

Went up to LA over the weekend to celebrate my brother's bday with the cousins. After bar hopping in Hollywood we all crashed at my cousin's place in Westchester. My little niece is growing these sprouts on the windowsill in the kitchen.

I didn't take very many photos while out and about but here's one of us at Beauty Bar.
This scan is really dusty. Too lazy to rescan it.
View On Black

My nephew was hard to keep up with. I got a bad sunburn. But on the bright side, I got rid of all my tan lines and have a nice even tone. Can't wait till my skin starts to peel! I lost my Paul Smith shades in the ocean :(. That's what I get for wearing them while trying to catch waves on an aerobed mattress. I'm a fucking retard.

This was the view from our campsite. We pitched our tent on a cliff just over the shoreline. As relaxing as the sound of the waves were, I had a hard time sleeping cause it was hot as hell. I think I woke up every hour throughout the night.

My parents planned a camping trip by the beach this weekend to celebrate Labor Day with a bunch of other relatives.  They'll be gone a total of two nights and the camp site is literally less than an hour away, but they're packing like they're about to board Oceanic Flight 815.  On top of all the food other people are bringing, they've got two huge ass coolers and two huge ass bins of snacks and a bunch of other crap they probably won't need.  I'm tagging along for a night and the only things I'm bringing are beer, limes, and my camera(s).  I'm all set, just waiting for them to finish packing the kitchen sink.
Just discovered her on youtube and instantly fell in love with her voice and talent. I love this modern day take on falling in love and dating...
View On Black

Eating Korean BBQ on the beach in Newport. Taken with my Holga on Kodak 400vc film. This Saturday will be our 10 year anniversary. 10 years! If our relationship were a person, it'd be a 5th grader. A dysfunctional 5th grader lol. I kid, I kid. He's my rock and I love him. Damn, time flies.

Downtown San Diego. Polaroid SX-70. 600 film. ND filter. I'm running low on polaroid film. :( I think I'm down to 2 packs. But the good news is, Urban Outfitters will be selling 779 film and other polaroid products. The bad news is, Urban Outfitters will be selling 779 film and other polaroid products. Don't get me wrong, I love Urban Outfitters, but the problem with a store like that selling vintage photography products is that I feel like they're selling a trend more than anything else. It cheapens the hobby and I feel like people don't appreciate the history or the art form itself. Rather, people buy it cause it's cool. The last time I was in the store I saw that they were selling twin-reflex cameras for $100, made out of plastic! Way to go Urban Outfitters! (read: fuck you Urban Outfitters!) For more info: www.the-impossible-project.com/

I was at my grandma's house over the weekend. She has this hand-carved wooden sculpture that I think my parents got her from Thailand. I try to spend as much time as I can with my grandma. She's still fairly healthy for her age and remains, for the most part, able-bodied (at least enough to get around without assistance from a walker or cane). However, over the past couple years she's definitely slowed down. She's not able to walk as far as she used to without complaining about pain in her joints. It was actually her birthday last friday (she turned 84), so my cousins and I took her to one of her favorite restaurants for lunch: Souplantation. It was nice to see her happy and surprised that we were all there, especially since my cousins don't come down to San Diego as often anymore. I love my grandma.
